text:
Hi,

Consider following scenario

Test Plan: 
a. TICK against "Run Each thread group separately"(i.e.run one group before 
starting the next)
b. Number of threads:40 for each script (Total 12 script in the test plan)
c. Ramp-up period:1 
d. Loop count:1

Bug:
when i try to run load test with above mentioned parameters at that 
time "java.net.ConnectException: Connection timed out: connect" error has been 
found

this error can be reproducible at anytime but strange thing is if i try to run 
this same test plan after half hour then it's working fine NO ERROR 

Please do the needful, Waiting for your reply.

Thanks,

Rushabh
creator: asl_rushabh@hotmail.com

text:
Created attachment 16881
Please refer attachment which i have got the error while running load test in Jmeter

Jmeter
creator: asl_rushabh@hotmail.com

text:
Connection timed out means that the connection to the remote system was not 
completed before the timeout expired.

This is caused by the remote server, not JMeter, so there's nothing we can do 
to fix this.
creator: sebb@apache.org

text:
(In reply to comment #2)
> Connection timed out means that the connection to the remote system was not 
> completed before the timeout expired.
> This is caused by the remote server, not JMeter, so there's nothing we can 
do 
> to fix this.

Hi..

Thanks for your prompt reply! OK i got your point but can you please tell me 
what should i do and how to configure remove server to resolve this issue.

Thanks in Adavance

Rushabh
creator: asl_rushabh@hotmail.com

text: Contact the remote server administrator and ask them for help.
creator: sebb@apache.org
